channel.title: Learning the basics of whats a good model
channel.description:
ok, when making a model, one may think,
1. what am i going to make? 2. how am i going to make it? 3. should i do it with primitives or tracing. 4. what should the finished wireframe product look like?
Answer:
1. The answer is completely up to you. what you want to make is completely up to the person making the "model".
2. You will need a modeling program. there are many ones out there but some free ones are Metasequoia, and Blender. The programs that cost money are, cinema 4d, autodesk maya, 3ds max and others.
3. When modeling, you should ALWAYS start with primitives. FOR NOW ON only model with primitives. NO more tracing. Almost everyone HATES looking at a really messy/horrible wireframe. so please you primitives.
4. your wireframe should NOT be in triangles. that just makes it look horrible as well. an example of a wireframe that you should have is something like this.
-->[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/249/kjkjkj.jpg/][IMG]http://img249.imageshack.us/img249/288/kjkjkj.jpg[/img][/URL]
Uploaded with [URL=http://imageshack.us]ImageShack.us[/URL]
dont ever make it look like this.(DONT EVEN POST IT)
an example of a Good wireframe is this.
-->[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/651/javaismy.png/][IMG]http://img651.imageshack.us/img651/9154/javaismy.png[/img][/URL]
(Java Is My Bitch's Model)
notice how this wireframe goes in a pattern, and looks nice and neat. that's how your models should look almost every time.
thanks for reading

item.title: Learning the basics of whats a good model
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:5, topic:417939”]Stop right there… just because primatives is the trend of modelling doesn’t mean tracing shouldn’t be used. I see a lot of people for years telling others not to trace because it is noob. Ignore them. Do it how ever you want and how it works for you.

Not to be a put down but nothing here is worth reading[/quote][sarcasm]Not to begin an argue or something, but in my opinion (even though I did primitive modelling myself) even the technique tells people what it’s all about, Primitive modelling, it’s old fashion, I’m not saying that people can’t do primitive modelling, it’s a good way to start, but once you’ve made some models in Meta using the primitive technique, they should try to move on with the tracing technique [/sarcasm]

Read full topic
item.source: Learning the basics of whats a good model

item.title: Learning the basics of whats a good model
item.dc:creator: @tubefish tubefish
item.description:
@tubefish wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:5, topic:417939”][quote author=tubefish link=topic=520490.msg3780222#msg3780222 date=1318393326]
3. When modeling, you should ALWAYS start with primitives. FOR NOW ON only model with primitives.
NO more tracing. Almost everyone HATES looking at a really messy/horrible wireframe. so please
you primitives.
[/quote]
Stop right there… just because primatives is the trend of modelling doesn’t mean tracing shouldn’t be used. I see a lot of people for years telling others not to trace because it is noob. Ignore them. Do it how ever you want and how it works for you.

Not to be a put down but nothing here is worth reading[/quote]

well there should be a proper way of modeling. and tracing free hand isnt good. tracing with primitives is fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Learning the basics of whats a good model
item.dc:creator: @Strangle Strangle
item.description:
@Strangle wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:5, topic:417939”][quote author=tubefish link=topic=520490.msg3780222#msg3780222 date=1318393326]
3. When modeling, you should ALWAYS start with primitives. FOR NOW ON only model with primitives.
NO more tracing. Almost everyone HATES looking at a really messy/horrible wireframe. so please
you primitives.
[/quote]
Stop right there… just because primatives is the trend of modelling doesn’t mean tracing shouldn’t be used. I see a lot of people for years telling others not to trace because it is noob. Ignore them. Do it how ever you want and how it works for you.

Not to be a put down but nothing here is worth reading[/quote]

Spline modelling is a good method you can use, There is a method of spline modelling in maya, Tracing can be effective, after the point in which you understand polyflow. Its not use Tracing something that has 100 polys and a bad polyflow, While you can do the same in 450 polys, with perfect polyflow.

Read full topic
item.source: Learning the basics of whats a good model

item.dc:creator: @Strangle Strangle
item.description:
@Strangle wrote:

Mikeyzzz:

Looks pretty cool, I might Pirate one of those paid ones.

Just a side note, I wouldnt mention that online… Never know whos watching. Also On topic. Alot of people should learn from this. If someone makes a very detailed verison of this, It should be sticky. and new people SHOULD read it before posting. It might cut down on the amount of Poly overkill

Read full topic
